Class QuizServer

java.lang.Object

extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject

doesExist

private void doesExist(java.io.File f,
                       java.lang.String filename)
Checks whether files of the expected names are present in the directory. If they are not found, new empty new .xml files are created.

Parameters:
f - - The File reference.
filename - - The filename.

copyOver

private void copyOver(java.lang.String filename)
XMLDecoder is used to deserialize the .xml files and convert them into objects.

Parameters:
filename - - The filename of the .xml file to be read from.

generateUniqueQuizID

public java.lang.String generateUniqueQuizID(java.lang.String name)
A quiz name is received from a client program, and a unique quiz ID is then generated from the first 4 (non-whitespace) characters. An integer is appended to these characters starting from 0, and this is incremented until a unique ID is made.

Specified by:
generateUniqueQuizID in interface Compute
Parameters:
name - - The quiz name.
Returns:
The unique quiz ID.

selectQuiz

public boolean selectQuiz(java.lang.String id)
Searches for a Quiz with an identical quiz ID.

Specified by:
selectQuiz in interface Compute
Parameters:
id - - The quiz ID to search the quizzes List for.
Returns:
True if a quiz already has this ID, false otherwise.

addQuestion

public void addQuestion(java.lang.String q)
Uses a String to create an instance of a Question object, which is then added to the quizInUse variable. The questionInUse variable is set to the newly created Question.

Specified by:
addQuestion in interface Compute
Parameters:
q - - Question as a String to be added a Quiz.

addOption

public void addOption(java.lang.String str)
Adds option to the questionInUse variable.

Specified by:
addOption in interface Compute
Parameters:
str - - The option as a String to be added to a Question.

setCorrect

public void setCorrect(char c)
Changes the correct option variable to the user input from the client side.

Specified by:
setCorrect in interface Compute
Parameters:
c - - The character that the correct option will be changed to.

getOptions

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getOptions()
Returns the list of options available from the questionInUse variable.

Specified by:
getOptions in interface Compute
Returns:
List of options as Strings.

printEntireQuiz

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> printEntireQuiz()
Returns a formatted list of the entire quizInUse. Each question is followed by its options, the correct option, and finally a line space.

Specified by:
printEntireQuiz in interface Compute
Returns:
A List of Strings that can be printed sequentially.

saveQuiz

public void saveQuiz()
The quizInUse object is added to the List of quizzes and the flush() method is called.

Specified by:
saveQuiz in interface Compute

getTop10

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTop10()
The top 10 Scores from the quizInUse are returned and formatted to be printed client side.

Specified by:
getTop10 in interface Compute
Returns:
A List of Strings, one for each Score that contains player data: the player's name, registered username, the points scored, the date the Score was created, and the player's email address.

getWinner

public java.lang.String getWinner()
The top Score from the quizInUse is returned and formatted to be printed client side.

Specified by:
getWinner in interface Compute
Returns:
A String that contains player data: the player's name, registered username, the points scored, the date the Score was created, and the player's email address.

formatDate

private java.lang.String formatDate(java.util.Calendar date)
Formats Calendar objects date for user legibility.

Parameters:
date - - The Calendar object to be formatted.
Returns:
The String in a readable format (dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm)

searchUser

public boolean searchUser(java.lang.String name)
The player username Map Key is used to see if the username is already in use.

Specified by:
searchUser in interface Compute
Parameters:
name - - The player's username.
Returns:
True if the username is already registered with a player, false otherwise.

enterPlayerData

public void enterPlayerData(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
Receives a List of Strings from the client, which can be parsed to obtain parameters to use for instantiation of a Player object. The newly-created Player object is then set as the playerInUse variable.

Specified by:
enterPlayerData in interface Compute
Parameters:
list - - List of Strings for the username, player name and email, sequentially.

getQuizNamesAndIDs

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getQuizNamesAndIDs()
Formats and returns a List of Strings for reading the list of quizzes available on the server.

Specified by:
getQuizNamesAndIDs in interface Compute
Returns:
A List of Strings, one String contains the quiz ID and quiz name.

getNumberOfQuestions

public int getNumberOfQuestions()
Returns the number of questions that the quizInUse Quiz has.

Specified by:
getNumberOfQuestions in interface Compute
Returns:
The number of questions in the Quiz.

getQuestionString

public java.lang.String getQuestionString(int questionNumber)
Sets the questionInUse object to the index of the list of questions in the quizInUse, and then returns the question variable as a String.

Specified by:
getQuestionString in interface Compute
Parameters:
questionNumber - - The index or position of the question in the list of questions for the quizInUse.
Returns:
The question variable of the questionInUse.

compareAnswers

public int compareAnswers(char[] charArray)
An array of characters is compared to an array of the correct answers for all questions of the quizInUse. For every match, the score is incremented by one and then returned.

Specified by:
compareAnswers in interface Compute
Parameters:
charArray - - Array of characters to be marked as correct or incorrect when compared to the correct variables in each Question object of the quizInUse.
Returns:
The total number of matches between the two arrays.

saveScore

private void saveScore(int num)
A new Score object is created, added to the appropriate Quiz object. The quizzes List is then saved to file.

Parameters:
num - - The points as an integer, to be added as a variable to a Score object.

flush

private void flush()
Prompts the server to save data to file using XML serialization.

encode

private void encode(java.lang.String filename)
XML Serialization of both players (ConcurrentMap) and quizzes (List) data structures. This method is synchronized so only one instance of the QuizServer class can write to file at one time.

Parameters:
filename - - The filename of the .xml file to write to.
